text: officer Lou's death it's a significant
event in the Asian community that we
Asians are also becoming recognized as
America
I would say this is a defining moment
for the city never in the history of the
NYPD never in the history of Chinese
American community as a Chinese officer
lost his life and lost their life this
way it's not just a job an
asian-american is being sacrificed and
is being part of an institution one of
the oldest institution in the city of
New York I'm the only one in my family
that is in office for me restores the
commitment I have for law enforcement
and for my brothers and sisters in law
enforcement and for the community that
we serve that we're out there trying to
help and do good for for others and
sometimes you have to pay the ultimate
price I think that Officer Lu's
sacrifice will not be in vain in fact
will probably encourage more young Asian
Americans to join the police department
in our home countries law enforcement
wasn't seen as a well-respected
profession it is only here that we have
shown and the community is more aware
that law enforcement is a well respected
profession to the young immigrants
joining the police department is also
the best way to be integrated into the
society there is no doubt in anyone's
mind that you see a police officer in
his uniform that he's an American
citizen he's an American
all
